uws.job.user

Interface JobOwner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultJobOwner

    public interface JobOwner
    Represents a user of a UWS and a potential job owner.
    Version:
    05/2012
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS)
    See Also:
    UserIdentifier

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getDataToSave()
      Gets all user data to save (including ID and pseudo/name).
      java.lang.String getID()
      Unique ID of a user.
      java.lang.String getPseudo()
      Pseudo of a user.
      boolean hasExecutePermission(UWSJob job)
      Tells whether this user has the right to execute and to abort the given job.
      boolean hasReadPermission(JobList jl)
      Tells whether this user has the right to list the jobs of the given jobs list.
      boolean hasReadPermission(UWSJob job)
      Tells whether this user has the right to read all parameters, errors and results of the given job.
      boolean hasWritePermission(JobList jl)
      Tells whether this user has the right to add/remove jobs to/from the given jobs list.
      boolean hasWritePermission(UWSJob job)
      Tells whether this user has the right to destroy the given job and to change the value of its parameters.
      void restoreData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data)
      Restores any additional user data from the given map.

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Unique ID of a user.
        Returns:
        User ID.

      • getPseudo

        java.lang.String getPseudo()
        Pseudo of a user. It is used only to display the identity of a user. note: a same pseudo may be used by several job owner.
        Returns:
        Pseudo/Name of a user.

      • hasReadPermission

        boolean hasReadPermission(JobList jl)
        Tells whether this user has the right to list the jobs of the given jobs list.
        Parameters:
        jl - A jobs list.
        Returns:
        true if this user can read the given jobs list, false otherwise.

      • hasWritePermission

        boolean hasWritePermission(JobList jl)
        Tells whether this user has the right to add/remove jobs to/from the given jobs list.
        Parameters:
        jl - A jobs list.
        Returns:
        true if this user can write the given jobs list, false otherwise.

      • hasReadPermission

        boolean hasReadPermission(UWSJob job)
        Tells whether this user has the right to read all parameters, errors and results of the given job.
        Parameters:
        job - A job.
        Returns:
        true if this user can read the given job, false otherwise.

      • hasWritePermission

        boolean hasWritePermission(UWSJob job)
        Tells whether this user has the right to destroy the given job and to change the value of its parameters.
        Parameters:
        job - A job.
        Returns:
        true if this user can write the given job, false otherwise.

      • hasExecutePermission

        boolean hasExecutePermission(UWSJob job)
        Tells whether this user has the right to execute and to abort the given job.
        Parameters:
        job - A job.
        Returns:
        true if this user can execute/abort the given job, false otherwise.

      • getDataToSave

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getDataToSave()
        Gets all user data to save (including ID and pseudo/name).
        Returns:
        A map with some key/value pairs, null or an empty map if no additional user data.

      • restoreData

        void restoreData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data)
        Restores any additional user data from the given map.
        Parameters:
        data - A map with some key/value pairs, null or an empty map if no additional user data.
